Talent & Wellbeing Advisor

Company Name Good Shepherd Microfinance Company Location Level 11, 350 Queen Street, Melbourne, VIC 3000, AU

New Posted Date Posted 2 minutes ago Number of views 1 view

Be an early applicant

Job description

• \xa0 Do you love to search for talent and on-board superstars?

• \xa0 Does the employee experience mean the world to you?

• \xa0 Join our stellar P&C team and help support our out-of-this-world organization!

\xa0

Join a high performing team with heart!

Good Shepherd Microfinance is a world leader in financial inclusion products, services and advisory. We offer fair and affordable financial programs to people on low incomes and advisory services for governments, businesses and other organisations. Our purpose is to enable economic wellbeing for people on low incomes, especially women and girls.

\xa0

What will be your key focus?

The People & Culture Team partners with all teams across Good Shepherd Microfinance and works closely with all managers. This role has been created in response to the growth and development of our work. Reporting to the People & Culture Manager, you will play a pivotal role in overseeing the recruitment and on boarding of talented and skilled employees to enable our strategic goals; lead a review of safety practices across all parts of the organization and coordinate and support other aspects of the employee life-cycle for our high performing team with heart.

\xa0

What will you need to succeed?

  • Tertiary qualifications in human resources
  • Demonstrated success providing in-house recruitment/talent acquisition services
  • Highly articulate with well-developed verbal and written communication skills and the capacity to influence
  • Attention to detail and the ability to perform work to a high standard of excellence
  • Demonstrated success in planning and implementing projects, experience working on safety and wellbeing projects preferred
  • The capacity and commitment to work in alignment with the values of Good Shepherd Microfinance

\xa0

More about us?

Our People & Culture Team (currently 2!) are a small, energetic band of problem-solvers. Playful, hard-working and passionate about all things people, are just a few of the ways they describe themselves. Oh and there’s coffee, lots of coffee.


At the core of our team are our values and a culture that invests strongly in professional development, workplace flexibility and employee wellbeing. In 2016, we were ranked in the top 10 most innovative not-for-profits in Australia and our work is growing! Our team has nearly doubled over the last couple of years and we’re proud that women make up 66% of management and to have team engagement scores that are some of the highest nationally. In addition, our remuneration includes generous salary packaging benefits that can increase take home pay.

\xa0

Interested? To learn more about us and to download the position description, visit www.goodshepherdmicrofinance.org.au/careers For further information and queries, contact Jo Caruso, People & Culture Manager at jcaruso@gsmicrofinance.org.au or on 0425 755 602.


To apply send your resume and a cover letter to: careers@gsmicrofinance.org.au. Your cover letter should tell us why you want to work with us, why you see yourself in this role and how you believe you meet the criteria outlined in the points above (also in the Position Description).

Please note: There is no closing date for applications but please apply as soon as possible as applications will be shortlisted as they are received.

\xa0

We recognise the rich diversity of people across Australia. We are committed to ensuring that our team is reflective of the diverse community we serve and to supporting a culture of equity, inclusion and diversity.

End User Computing Solution Principal

Company Name Dell Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 96 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

End User Computing Solution Principal
Melbourne, Australia 09/04/2018

End User Computing Solution Principal - ANZ

Competitive salary

Australia Remote, Melbourne or Sydney Based

Dell provides the technology that transforms the way we all work and live. But we are more than a technology company — we are a people company. We inspire, challenge and respect every one of our over 100,000 employees. We also provide them with unparalleled growth and development opportunities. We can’t wait for you to discover this for yourself as a End User Computing Solution Principal on our Support & Deployment Services Sales team in Australia.

Our field sales professionals rely on proactive technical support during the sales process – and our expert Systems Engineering team always steps up to the mark. We lead the development and implementation of complex and specialized products, applications, services and solutions. From delivering sales presentations and product demonstrations, to developing detailed installations or system integration plans, we ensure customers get the innovative, relevant, interoperable solutions they need.

Key Responsibilities

  • Primary subject matter expert to construct the specific solution, scope document, risk profile, and corresponding financials.
  • Uses expertise to construct specific and detailed solutions that encompass process, technology, project and staffing plans.
  • Constructs risk assessments and corresponding remediation plans relative to custom solution proposals.
  • Participates in the construction of financial models that align with custom solution proposals.
  • Composes applicable services agreements (e.g. Statements of Work, SLA documentation, etc) that specify processes, technology, staffing, deliverables, commitments, risk, and project management aspects of a solution.
  • Supports deal negotiation and closure to include transition support to service delivery.
  • Serves as a services subject matter expert to both internal and external customers.
  • Follows all organizational standard operating procedures relative to cost modeling, approvals and reviews, and all other associated workflow, documentation and deliverables.
  • Participates in applicable win-loss reviews and incorporates learnings into future solutions.

    • Essential Requirements
    • Degree and/or appropriate mix of experience related to technical or business consulting activities with Microsoft Enterprise technologies:
    • MCITP or MCSE
    • Current relevant Third Party Certifications
    • VMWare VCP/ VCAP 6/7 – Desktop & Mobility Deployment
    • Citrix CCE,CCP

    Desirable Requirements

  • 8-10 years of relevant experience or equivalent combination of education and work experience.
  • Subject matter expert in several of the following technologies:
  • Windows 10 Migration and Deployment Strategy, SOE Design and Development
  • Application Compatibility Testing, Rationalisation, Packaging and Remediation
  • Systems Management including SCCM, Intune, Workspace One / Airwatch, KACE
  • Virtual Desktop Infrastructure including VMware Workspace One / Horizon, Microsoft VDI, Citrix XenApp / XenDesktop, Wyse WSM.
  • Application Virtualisation including Microsoft App-V, VMware ThinApp, Citrix XenApp
  • Profile & Persona Assessment and Management including AppSense Environment Manager, Management, Liquidware Labs Stratusphere FIT, UX and ProfileUnity, Lakeside Systrack

    • Benefits

    We offer highly competitive salaries, bonus programs, world-class benefits, and unparalleled growth and development opportunities — all to create a compelling and rewarding work environment.

    If you have the technical skills to take our sales to the next level, this is your opportunity to develop with Dell.

    Closing date: 14th September 2018.

    Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Learn more about Diversity and Inclusion at Dell here.

    The End User Computing Solution Principal is a pre-sales role within Dell’s Support and Deployment Services Sales team. The role is primarily a pre-sales architecture role, however Solution Principals are also responsible for supporting initial stages of delivery of large and complex projects where a high level of architecture oversight is required. The architect is expected to review and validate designs developed by Dell Consultants in professional services delivery, however the architect is not usually responsible for developing detailed technical designs.

    The End User Computing Solution Principal is responsible for translating the client's business requirements into specific systems, applications and/or process designs for custom technical solutions.

    Analyses customer requirements and designs solutions to meet the customer objectives and balances the needs of sales and delivery to design a solution that meets or exceeds the requirements of service delivery.
    Job Function: Engineering
    Job ID: R65318
    Apply now

Job description

We currently have an exciting opportunity for an experienced incentive marketing Account Manager to join our rapidly growing team in Melbourne.


The Account Manager is responsible for new program design and strategy, ensuring the successful implementation and ongoing management of loyalty, incentive and reward and recognition programs for our clients. You will generate ideas for program growth and improvement, ensuring client objectives are met, all the while looking for ongoing up-sell and growth opportunities.


You will be responsible for day-to-day client contact and end to end ownership of program strategy, generating ideas for integrated marketing campaigns to support program go-to-market activity and ongoing engagement. You will be the key point of contact to brief creative and development teams and facilitate regular strategic meeting with clients.

If you have a passion for loyalty and incentive programs, motivating employees and driving results for clients we would love to hear from you!


Desired Experience

  • 3-5 years demonstrated industry experience in Incentives, Customer Loyalty and or Reward & Recognition programs.
  • Client management experience - the ability to deal with clients at all levels and translate client needs into a complete strategic solution
  • Experience in delivering end to end solutions specifically in relation to program launch and campaign management
  • Experience in translating client requirements into design and development requirements.
  • Ability to read, review and translate campaign analytics to clients

\xa0

Desired Skills

  • Strong data management and analytical skills
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Project management skills
  • Adaptable and enthusiastic
  • A team player
  • Able to work hard, but have a laugh and have fun
  • Strong organisational skills - highly methodical, accurate and deadline driven
  • Computer literate (i.e. Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
  • Ability to take ownership, accept responsibility and be accountable


The Benefits

We are a growing team in an established brand and will provide an environment with unlimited rewards and real opportunities. Among many fantastic employee benefits CILOYALTY offers:

  • A competitive base salary package, commensurate with your skills and experience
  • Career advancement opportunities within a growing business
  • Ongoing training and development with opportunities to work overseas if desired
  • Additional leave day for your birthday!
  • An amazing workplace culture
  • The world-renowned benefits of becoming part of the Flight Centre Travel Group including access to discount travel, global career opportunities and access to free health and financial consultations


Our culture is fun, supportive and dynamic, and will see you join a team full of experienced professionals climbing the ladder together to achieve career growth and development. Don’t miss out on this exciting opportunity with a rewarding package.

Group Audit and Risk Manager

Company Name McMillan Shakespeare (MMSG) Company Location 360 Elizabeth Street , Melbourne, VIC 3000, AU

New Posted Date Posted 27 minutes ago Number of views 3 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

We have a fantastic opportunity for a Group Audit and Risk Manager to work on 3 days per week arrangement. Reporting to the Group CFO, the Audit and Risk Manager is responsible for regular review of all internal controls within all our brands.
\xa0
Working in close collaboration with the External and Internal Auditors, the role is accountable for ensuring the business maintains and conforms with the internal control framework that has been established to provide senior management with the confidence and reliance that all significant risks are being appropriately managed and controlled. . This will include delivery of quality outcomes in relation to the \xa0internal control framework, risk mitigation, internal audit and external audit recommendations, payment controls, account reconciliations, system access controls and internal compliance monitoring.
\xa0
Key responsibilties:

  • Ensure regular and prescribed operational audits and controls are undertaken in accordance with Group policies and procedures.
  • Present regular audit reports to management verifying the accuracy of transactions and report on other significant findings in relation to operational practices.
  • Help facilitate the internal audit process by acting as a key point of contact in the business for internal auditors and drive the required outcomes identified in the audit findings.
  • Champion controls and compliance within the MMSG business by ensuring that all work practices are aligned with policy, process, contractual and legislative requirements.
  • Ensure payments controls are effective and maintained across the MMSG group.
  • Identify and implement control improvements across the MMSG group
  • Implement a system, bank account, payroll access and review process to ensure only appropriate staff have access at all times.
  • Produce a variety of reports on risk mitigation and identification of improvement opportunities.
You will bring:
  • Strong audit or accounting background with a minimum of 10 years experience leading audit and compliance related functions
  • Proven understanding of compliance and risk management strategies
  • Strong commercial acumen and professional judgement
  • Track record of effective improvement initiatives in ambiguous and emerging environments
  • Ability to influence and generate commitment to the achievement of controls across all levels of the busines
  • Structured, analytical approach to problem solving
  • Proven ability to work to tight deadlines and effectively manage conflicting priorities
  • Pro-actively seeks continuous improvement opportunities

Service & Parts Analyst

Company Name Renault Australia Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 18 hours ago Number of views 53 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Renault Australia are now seeking to engage a Service and Parts Analyst to join the Renault Aftersales team. This dual role is responsible for supporting product and service improvements within our business through detailed analysis and identification of issues that impact product and service quality in Renault’s Dealer Network. \xa0This role is also responsible for providing a high level of data and reporting support to assist in parts commercial and logistic activities.

\xa0

This position will report directly to the National Service Manager, with key responsibilities for the following:

  • Provide QVN, QSA, ARC and TGW data and analysis via the Potentiate portal and Harmoni database for all departments.

  • Assist in developing and monitoring actions to improve product and service quality.

  • Obtain and provide product quality and customer research.

  • Monitor network service capacity to ensure customer’s current and future needs are met.

  • Manage the daily reporting operation of the QVN and QSA surveys.

  • Manage the daily operations and data requirements for the ARC survey and represent the brand on the industry ARC committee.

  • Assist the technical department through the application of statistical analysis.

  • Support customer relations data analytics.

  • Ensure warranty, incidentology, IQ and CPS data is of sufficient standard to ensure accurate reporting.

  • Ensure dealer data is of sufficient standard to ensure effective operation of the Potentiate and Nidasu Systems.

  • Manage all upgrade projects and ongoing data integrity for CPS program.

  • Manage all upgrade projects for QVN & QSA (VoC).

  • Support data analysis and reporting for the Alliance warehouse daily operations.

  • Support the maintenance of accurate parts stock levels.

  • Support the management of the warehouse cycle count process.

  • Support the synchronisation of the NAPS (Renault) and Matrix (Warehouse) systems.

  • Support the conclusion of Dealer parts enquires through Dialogys and the IQ system.

  • Support the conclusion of logistics issues for the Dealer Network.

  • Assist the wider Aftersales team in special projects and ad hoc reporting tasks as required.

\xa0

To be considered for this opportunity, you will need:

  • Degree in Engineering/Quality Discipline, Business Analytics, Statistics or a similar field.

  • Applied advanced Microsoft skills, specifically in Excel and PowerPoint essential.

  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to demonstrate clear and logical methodology.

  • Technologically savvy with the ability to learn new systems and processes.

  • Excellent attention to detail and problem solving skills.

  • Exemplary interpersonal and communication skills, and the ability to deliver clear and concise messages to the business and external stakeholders.

  • Strong organisational and time management skills, with ability to perform under pressure and manage multiple deadlines.

  • Enthusiastic and demonstrated initiative.\xa0\xa0
